text: Psalm 19
Yahweh’s Creation and Law
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 19 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
The heavens \add are\add* telling the glory of God,
and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.
⸤Every day⸥\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Literally “day to day” \f* \add they\add* pour forth speech,
and ⸤every night⸥\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Literally “night to night” \f* \add they\add* tell knowledge.
There is no speech and there are no words;
their sound is inaudible.
\add Yet\add* in all \add the\add* world their line\f + \fr 19:4 \ft LXX “line” \f* goes out,
and their words to \add the\add* end of \add the\add* world.
In them\f + \fr 19:4 \ft That is, the heavens \f* he has pitched a tent for the sun,
and it \add is\add* like a bridegroom
who comes out of his bridal chamber.
It is glad like a strong man
to run \add its\add* course.
Its rising \add is\add* from \add one\add*\f + \fr 19:6 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* end of the heavens
and its circuit to the \add other\add* end\f + \fr 19:6 \ft Hebrew “ends” \f* of them;
and nothing \add is\add* hidden from its heat.
The law of Yahweh \add is\add* perfect, reviving life.\f + \fr 19:7 \ft Or “soul” \f*
The testimony of Yahweh \add is\add* firm, making wise \add the\add* simple.
The precepts of Yahweh \add are\add* right, making \add the\add* heart rejoice.
The command of Yahweh \add is\add* pure, enlightening \add the\add* eyes.
The fear of Yahweh \add is\add* pure, enduring forever.
The ordinances of Yahweh \add are\add* true; they are righteous altogether,
more desirable than gold, even much fine gold;
and sweeter than honey, even honey \add in the\add* comb.
Moreover, your servant \add is\add* warned\f + \fr 19:11 \ft Or “illumined” \f* by them;
in keeping them \add is\add* great reward.
Who can perceive \add his\add* errors?
Acquit me from hidden \add faults\add*.
Also, keep back your servant from arrogant \add sins\add*;\f + \fr 19:13 \ft Usage elsewhere might suggest “arrogant people” \f*
let them not rule over me.
Then I shall be blameless,
and I shall be innocent of great transgression.
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
be acceptable in your presence,
O Yahweh, my rock and my redeemer.
